definitions.definition: A line that is a base for measurement or for construction .
examples: A laser level generates a convenient baseline for interior work.

definitions.definition: A datum used as the basis for calculation or for comparison .
examples: We used the last doctor visit to provide baselines for vital statistics.

definitions.definition: A line used as the basis for the alignment of glyphs .
examples: Several characters typically have descenders below the lower baseline .

definitions.definition: The line at the farthest ends of the court indicating the boundary of the area of play.
examples: The umpire missed the call. The ball hit the baseline .

definitions.definition: A configuration of software , hardware , or a process that is established and documented as a point of reference .
examples: The baseline configuration includes unsupported components.

main_definition: A line that is a base for measurement or for construction .
secondary_definitions: A datum used as the basis for calculation or for comparison .
( typography ) A line used as the basis for the alignment of glyphs .
( tennis ) The line at the farthest ends of the court indicating the boundary of the area of play.
( engineering ) A configuration of software , hardware , or a process that is established and documented as a point of reference .
